org.xadisk.bridge.proxies.interfaces
Interface XADiskBasicIOOperations

All Known Subinterfaces:
Session, XADiskConnection, XADiskRemoteConnection, XASession
public interface XADiskBasicIOOperations

This interface declares a set of i/o operations which can be called on XADisk.

An object of this interface is obtained as a session object (Session), XA-enabled session object (XASession) or as a connection object (XADiskConnection).

Since:
1.0

Nested Class Summary
static class XADiskBasicIOOperations.PermissionType
          This enum enumerates the set of permission types required to perform read or write operations on files and directories.

Method Detail

setPublishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit

void setPublishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit(boolean publish)
Sets the values of publishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit.

This property can be used to control whether the commit of the transaction on this object should result in publishing of events to registered MessageDrivenBeans or not.

Parameters:
publish - new value of publishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit.

getPublishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit

boolean getPublishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit()
Returns the value of publishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit.

This property can be used to control whether the commit of the transaction on this object should result in publishing of events to registered MessageDrivenBeans or not.

Returns:
value of publishFileStateChangeEventsOnCommit.

getFileLockWaitTimeout

long getFileLockWaitTimeout()
Returns the current value of the lock wait timeout for this object.

This is the time an i/o operation will wait for acquiring a lock over a file/directory. Waiting for a lock allows some space for other transactions holding the lock to complete and release the locks.

Note that the value of lock wait timeout period defaults to the global-configuration.

Returns:
the lock wait timeout, in milliseconds.

setFileLockWaitTimeout

void setFileLockWaitTimeout(long fileLockWaitTimeout)
Sets a new value for the lock wait timeout for this object.

This is the time an i/o operation will wait for acquiring a lock over a file/directory. Waiting for a lock allows some space for other transactions holding the lock to complete and release the locks.

Note that the value of lock wait timeout period defaults to the global-configuration.

Parameters:
fileLockWaitTimeout - the new lock wait timeout, in milliseconds.

createXAFileInputStream

XAFileInputStream createXAFileInputStream(File f,
                                          boolean lockExclusively)
                                          throws FileNotExistsException,
                                                 InsufficientPermissionOnFileException,
                                                 LockingFailedException,
                                                 NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                                                 InterruptedException
Creates an input stream to the file. This stream can be further be wrapped by a utility class XAFileInputStreamWrapper to get easy pluggability via the standard InputStream.

Parameters:
f - the target file from where to read.
lockExclusively - set to true for obtaining an exclusive lock over the file or directory. False will only obtain a shared lock.
Returns:
the input stream object.
Throws:
FileNotExistsException
InsufficientPermissionOnFileException
LockingFailedException
NoTransactionAssociatedException
InterruptedException

createXAFileInputStream

XAFileInputStream createXAFileInputStream(File f)
                                          throws FileNotExistsException,
                                                 InsufficientPermissionOnFileException,
                                                 LockingFailedException,
                                                 NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                                                 InterruptedException
Creates an input stream to the file. This stream can be further be wrapped by a utility class XAFileInputStreamWrapper to get easy pluggability via the standard InputStream. This method is equivalent to: createXAFileInputStream(f, false)

Parameters:
f - the target file from where to read.
Returns:
the input stream object.
Throws:
FileNotExistsException
InsufficientPermissionOnFileException
LockingFailedException
NoTransactionAssociatedException
InterruptedException
Since:
1.1

createXAFileOutputStream

XAFileOutputStream createXAFileOutputStream(File f,
                                            boolean heavyWrite)
                                            throws FileNotExistsException,
                                                   FileUnderUseException,
                                                   InsufficientPermissionOnFileException,
                                                   LockingFailedException,
                                                   NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                                                   InterruptedException
Creates an output stream to the file. The file should exist from the viewpoint of the current transaction (i.e. if the file didn't exist before the transaction, it should be created first).

This stream would always append to the file.

To write at an arbitrary offset of the file, this method can be used along with truncateFile(java.io.File, long) and the XAFileInputStream for example.

This stream can further be wrapped by a utility class XAFileOutputStreamWrapper to get easy pluggability via the standard OutputStream.

Parameters:
f - the target file to which to write.
heavyWrite - a clue for performance tuning. When writing just a few hundred bytes, set this to false.
Returns:
the output stream object.
Throws:
FileNotExistsException
FileUnderUseException
InsufficientPermissionOnFileException
LockingFailedException
NoTransactionAssociatedException
InterruptedException

fileExists

                   throws LockingFailedException,
                          NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                          InsufficientPermissionOnFileException,
                          InterruptedException
Tells whether the file or directory exists.

Parameters:
f - the file/directory path.
lockExclusively - set to true for obtaining an exclusive lock over the file or directory. False will only obtain a shared lock.
Returns:
true if the file/directory exists.
Throws:
LockingFailedException
NoTransactionAssociatedException
InterruptedException
InsufficientPermissionOnFileException

listFiles

String[] listFiles(File f,
                   boolean lockExclusively)
                   throws FileNotExistsException,
                          LockingFailedException,
                          NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                          InterruptedException,
                          InsufficientPermissionOnFileException
Lists the contents of the directory.

Parameters:
f - the directory path.
lockExclusively - this parameter is ignored and is being retained only to protect existing applications' code. Version 1.1 onwards, this method is equivalent to listFiles(f) .
Returns:
an array of Strings containing names of files/directories.
Throws:
FileNotExistsException
LockingFailedException
NoTransactionAssociatedException
InterruptedException
InsufficientPermissionOnFileException

truncateFile

void truncateFile(File f,
                  long newLength)
                  throws FileNotExistsException,
                         InsufficientPermissionOnFileException,
                         LockingFailedException,
                         NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                         InterruptedException
Truncates a file.

Parameters:
f - the file path.
newLength - new length to truncate to. It should be a non-negative number less than or equal to the file size.
Throws:
FileNotExistsException
InsufficientPermissionOnFileException
LockingFailedException
NoTransactionAssociatedException
InterruptedException
